solution_line_template: If Phil has one-third of the amount that Bob does, that means he has ${bob_money}/{phil_fraction_denominator}= $<<{bob_money}/{phil_fraction_denominator}={phil_money}>>{phil_money} in his account.
Since Jenna has twice as much money as Phil, that means she has ${phil_money}*{jenna_multiplier}= <<{phil_money}*{jenna_multiplier}={jenna_money}>>{jenna_money} in her account.
Since Bob has ${bob_money} in his account, that means he has ${bob_money}-${jenna_money}=${money_difference}<<{bob_money}-{jenna_money}={money_difference}>>{money_difference} more than Jenna.
